intro: Carmichaelia gracilis, commonly known as the slender kōwhai, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal and lowland areas, often in sandy or rocky soils. It has a slender, shrub-like form and is well adapted to the temperate climate of its native habitat. Carmichaelia gracilis plays a role in local ecosystems and is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value.
